verses.roman:
tataḥ pravyathito bāṇo
duhituḥ śruta-dūṣaṇaḥ
tvaritaḥ kanyakāgāraṁ
prāpto 'drākṣīd yadūdvaham

synonyms: tataḥ—then; pravyathitaḥ—very agitated; bāṇaḥ—Bāṇāsura; duhituḥ—of his daughter; śruta—having heard of; dūṣaṇaḥ—the corruption; tvaritaḥ—quickly; kanyakā—of the unmarried girls; āgāram—the quarters; prāptaḥ—reaching; adrākṣīt—he saw; yadu-udvaham—the most eminent of the Yadus.
translation: Very agitated to hear of his daughter's corruption, Bāṇāsura rushed at once to the maidens' quarters. There he saw the pride of the Yadus, Aniruddha.
